intro: Lippia primulina var. goyazensis, commonly known as the Goiás lippia, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
